item.Name: always render in floating shadow#will not work on child objects
extension of parent#object uses parent's markers
effects created by this object do not spawn objects in multiplayer
does not collide with camera#force camera not to collide with object. By default small sweetener objects do not collide
force collide with camera#force the camera to collide with this object, By default small sweetener objects do not collide
damage not blocked by obstructions#AOE damage being applied to this object does not test for obstrutions.
grab parent object in forge editing
Renderer should send visibility up to game thread
Sleep when not visible to player
Killed on first contact or damage#the object is killed instantly the first time it is contacted or damaged (optional grace period below)
Self-destruct timer kills instead of destroying#object is killed instantly, not destroyed (deleted) when the self-destruct timer expires

_field_real.name: bounding radius#If you edit this field manually, beware that the render model is no longer respected for radius calculation and that you need to set the bounding offset as well.
rolling ramp up time:seconds#how long it takes to set the rolling ramp RTPC from 0-1
grinding ramp up time:seconds#how long it takes to set the grinding ramp RTPC from 0-1

plugin._field_explanation: Damage source name for all damage caused by this object. This includes: - collision damage caused by this object - melee damage caused by this object (including melee-like special abilities) - damage caused by projectiles created by this object - damage caused by damage effects created by this object (such as weapon backfiring)

_field_explanation.name: only set this tag if you want to override the default collision damage values in globals.globals

_field_tag_reference_64.name: melee sound#this is the sound that is made when I am meleed. This overrides the sweetener sound of my material.

_field_real.name: kill on first contact or damage after time:seconds#grace period before object can be instantly killed by kill on first contact or damage flag
self-destruct time:seconds#if non-zero, any instances of this object will destroy themselves after this many seconds.
self-destruct time max:seconds#if non-zero, defines range from which self-destruct time is chosen randomly

_field_string_id.name: ai type name#used for combat dialogue, etc.
interaction name#if you checked the consider for interaction flag, type what interaction the AI should do with this object (NYI - you can use any)

item.Name: invert#result of function is one minus actual result
mapping does not controls active#the curve mapping can make the function active/inactive
always active#function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound
random time offset#function offsets periodic function input by random value between 0 and 1
always exports value#when this function is deactivated, it still exports its value
turn off with uses magnitude#the function will be turned off if the value of the turns_off_with function is 0

_field_string_id.name: import name#if you leave this field blank then you can set this function's input value with the hs_function object_set_function_variable
turn off with#if the specified function is off, so is this function
ranged interpolation name#if you have the ranged button checked

_field_real.name: min value#function must exceed this value (after mapping) to be active 0. means do nothing

_field_block_64.name: interpolation

item.Name: fractional#covers a fixed fraction of the distance to the target on each update

_field_real.name: linear travel time:s#used by constant velocity

_field_block_64._field_explanation: the damping ratio is c/(2*sqrt(k)). if this ratio is: = 0 : oscillates forever < 1 : oscillates with decreasing amplitude = 1 : reaches the target precisely and quickly (no oscillation) > 1 : reaches the target slowly the higher the value of k, the quicker the system will reach the target value

_field_real.name: spring k#used by damped spring determines acceleration by displacement
spring c#used by damped spring determines damping based on velocity
fraction:0-1#used by fractional how mush of the distance to the target to cover each update

_field_long_integer.name: runtime interpolator to object function mapping*!

_field_real_bounds.name: selection bounds#if the switch function is between these values, this function will be picked

item.Name: never delete on bsp transition#This object and any objects in its parent-child chain will never be deleted when transitioning between BSPs
Aim assist raycast does not ignore parents
Combine child shapes into convext hull when cutting navmesh

_field_tag_reference_64.name: type^
_field_tag_reference_64.validtags: ligh, gldf, ltvl, effe, lsnd, lens, cpem, egfd, decs

_field_tag_reference_64.name: override type#this attachment will override the attachment on the object that shares this
_field_tag_reference_64.validtags: ligh, gldf, ltvl, effe, lsnd, lens, cpem, egfd, decs

item.Name: force always on#when this flag is clear we only create the attachment when the function object function is active or set to empty string
effect size scale from object scale
works on land#drives on an extruded version of everything physical in your level

_field_string_id.name: variant name#if empty, may be used by any model variant

item.Name: blend in hsv#blends colors in hsv rather than rgb space
...more colors#blends colors through more hues (goes the long way around the color wheel)

_field_block_64.name: multiplayer object
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Type pertains to how you want the game engine to handle this object Certain flags applicable only to certain object types, should be self evident
These fields are only used for goal area objects with boundaries, and for respawn zones
These fields are used for default spawning times and remapping

item.Name: Only render if editable{only render in editor}{only visible in editor}#This object will only render if you're in editor, or in a Forge game where the instance of the object is Forge-able
DEPRECATED phased physics in forge{phased physics in forge}
Only collision if editable{only collision in editor}#This object will only have collision if you're in editor, or in a Forge game and the instance of the object is Forge-able
Only physics if editable{only physics in editor}#This object will only have physics if you're in editor, or in a Forge game and the instance of the object is Forge-able
Force render in Forge#Regardless of 'do not render if can't be edited' or other flags, we will try to render this object in Forge games

_field_block_64._field_explanation: These are respawn zone weights, used only for respawn zones

_field_block_64.name: falloff function#Multiplier applied to weight (domain is center to radius, range should be 0 to 1).

_field_block_64._field_explanation: These fields are only used for defining certain, special markers to use for positional locations if the default position (object origin) is not sufficient
If this object is intended to spawn something, the object it spawns should be specified here
These are default shaders used for boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for spherical boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for cylindrical boundary geometry
These are custom shaders used for box boundary geometry
These fields are used for default behaviors in Forge mode

_field_string_id.name: Default Primary Color#Name reference into the Forge colors + Forge color references block in forge.forge_globals. If empty we use global default.
Default Secondary Color#Name reference into the Forge colors + Forge color references block in forge.forge_globals. If empty we use global default.
Default Tertiary Color#Name reference into the Forge colors + Forge color references block in forge.forge_globals. If empty we use global default.

_field_char_integer.name: Default Primary Glossiness#If 0 we use global default.
Default Secondary Glossiness#If 0 we use global default.
Default Tertiary Glossiness#If 0 we use global default.

_field_string_id.name: Default Label [1]#Label reference into the Forge labels block in forge.forge_globals
Default Label [2]#Label reference into the Forge labels block in forge.forge_globals
Default Label [3]#Label reference into the Forge labels block in forge.forge_globals
Default Label [4]#Label reference into the Forge labels block in forge.forge_globals
Variant Name#Only use this if your object has multiple variants

_field_tag_reference_64.name: simulation_interpolation#Set to a specific interpolation definition, or leave blank to inherit the default for the object type (there are defaults for bipeds, vehicles, and crates in multiplayer_globals). To disable interpolation on a particular object whose type has interpolation by default, set this reference to the special disable_interpolation.simulation_interpolation tag.

_field_block_64.name: spawn effects
_field_block_64._field_explanation: Effect played when an object of this type spawns in during each game mode. Unlike creation effect, it is only played when the object spawns in through certain methods, not whenever one is created.

_field_tag_reference_64.name: multiplayer spawn effect#effect played when this object spawns in MP games
campaign spawn effect#effect played when this object spawns in Campaign games

_field_string_id.name: alias of#(Optional) If set will internally read this instead of 'id' to generate the smoothed value. Can be used to create smoothed aliases of existing functions.

_field_real_fraction.name: smoothing factor

_field_block_64.name: Tracking Info&Spartan Tracking

_field_explanation.name: Map these settings to a ping type

_field_block_64._field_explanation:
Active - This is generated manually by the player, by pressing a button on their controller. This behavior will override passive behavior.
Passive - This is a constant ping, automatically generated by the tracking system. Use this to mark things automatically as the player comes into range.
You should create at most one block of Spartan Tracking data for each ping type. If you have more, only the first will be used.

_field_char_enum.name: ping type^#ping type to which these settings apply

item.Name: trackable#this object may respond to the ping of a Spartan tracking device
enabled by default#this object is trackable by default, i.e. tracking does not need to be enabled via script
outline#render an outline around the object when pinged
immediate response#ping affects this object immediately, only applicable to active ping type
follow offscreen#nav marker will follow this object while offscreen
do not track children#prevent tracking of child objects
do not outline children#prevent outlining of child objects

_field_char_enum.name: priority#category used to limit the number of simultaneously marked targets
outline color index#index into outline material's 4-color 'outline_color' parameter

_field_real_fraction.name: outline intensity:(0,1] - if 0, default from tracking globals tag will be used
outline thickness:(0,1] - if 0, default from tracking globals tag will be used

_field_string_id.name: nav point screen#name of the screen used to mark this object when hit by a ping
nav point label#label displayed via the nav point screen

_field_real.name: nav point vertical offset:world units#offset used when displaying the nav point screen and label

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Leave the override set to 0 if you'd like to use the default range. A set of default ranges, for each ping type, is stored under the Spartan Tracking section of globals.globals. Each set specifies a default range for each target priority.

_field_real.name: range&range override#maximum distance at which this object can be hit by a ping

_field_long_flags.name: team filter#character teams that can't ping this object

item.Name: blue team#The Chief and his crew
blue team cracked#The Chief and his crew, but Chief has a cracked visor

_field_tag_reference_64.name: ping hit instigator effect 0&team Chief ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit instigator effect 1{ping hit instigator effect}&team Locke ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit instigator effect 2&team Chief (cracked visor) ping hit instigator effect#effect on the spartan when this object is hit by ping
ping hit effect 0&team Chief ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping
ping hit effect 1{ping hit effect}&team Locke ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping
ping hit effect 2&team Chief (cracked visor) ping hit effect#effect on this object when hit by ping

item.Name: use ground scale for all unspecified attachments
fixup position upon detaching from parent
fixup position after attaching to parent
item requires a child to be a pickup item#Set this to have a pickup item get dropped if the object that spawns it is no longer a child of the owning unit

plugin._field_explanation: everything you need to display things
because grenades look better as coconuts. 0==1

_field_tag_reference_64.name: grounded friction settings#If not present, the default from global.globals is used.
Tossed Override# Used to override the object tossed when item owner is killed. Is overridden by tossed weapon override.

item.Name: hide FP weapon when in iron sights#for scoped weapons
weapon ages with each kill#see 'weapon ages when damage is inflicted', 'per kill or hit aging amount'
strict deviation angle#deviation angle is allowed to be less than primary autoaim angle - for the rocket launcher
notifies target units#aiming this weapon at another player can be important to them - for lock-on weapons
non-lunge melee dash disabled#melee-physics dash is disabled on melees that are not lunges
don't drop on dual wield melee
is equipment special weapon#when checked, this weapon -is deleted when dropped -does not count against maximum inventory -gets deleted on host migrations -prevents swapping or switching weapons
force tracers to come from weapon barrel#setting this forces effects tracers to come from weapon barrel instead of eye point
AI cannot fire tracking projectiles#setting this will remove tracking data from AI-fired projectiles

force match owner animation#WARNING checking this will make the weapon only usable by AI. The weapon will either match the owner's animation if a matching animation is found. Otherwise the weapon goes to idle.
weapon unzooms on damage#taking damage while wielding this will ping player out of zoom/iron sights
do not drop on equipment activation#will counteract default support weapon behavior to drop on equipment activation
weapon can not be dropped#used for CTF magnum, weapon can not be dropped or swapped out
throw weapon on primary fire#Throws weapon when primary fire trigger is pulled
do not drop 'must be readied' on primary trigger#Allows 'must be readied' weapons to have a primary attack
allow melee when using device#Default behavior prevents melee attacks when using device. Setting this bit allows them.
do not lower weapon when using device#Default behavior lowers weapon when using device. Setting this leaves the weapon up.
weapon ages when damage is inflicted#see 'weapon ages with each kill', 'per kill or hit aging amount'
apply gunner armor mod abilites#Apply weapon's gunner armor mod movement penalty multipliers rather than base multipliers when gunner armor mod is active in _trait_weapons_gunner_armor_modifier
wielders sprint is unaffected by stopping power{wielders sprint is unaffected by soft ping}#if stopping power is enabled in the sprint ability then this blocks the effect when this weapon is held
weapon drops further away#Adds velocity to weapon's default drop (useful for weapons with auto-pickup)
do not drop on assassination#Keeps the weapon in your hand while being assassinated or performing an assassination (for must_be_readied or support weapons)
is part of body#Keeps the weapon from dropping or being hidden at the start of assassinations, and must instead be dropped using the drop weapon keyframe
hide pickup prompt unless special pickup priority#Used for Oddball that only shows the pickup prompt when megalo script sets pickup priority to special
weapon ignores player_pickup_allowed trait#Player will always pickup this weapon if requested, Used for CTF that needs to force storm_magnum_ctf onto the player
No idle to precision idle transition while evading
No idle to precision idle transition while firing
No idle to precision idle transition while reloading
Firing animations are blocked during ADS transitions

_field_real.name: turn on time#how long after being readied it takes this weapon to switch its 'turned_on' attachment to 1.0

_field_real_fraction.name: heat recovery threshold:[0,1]#the heat value a weapon must return to before leaving the overheated state, once it has become overheated in the first place
overheated threshold:[0,1]#the heat value over which a weapon first becomes overheated (should be greater than the heat recovery threshold)
heat detonation threshold:[0,1]#the heat value above which the weapon has a chance of exploding each time it is fired
heat detonation fraction:[0,1]#the percent chance (between 0.0 and 1.0) the weapon will explode when fired over the heat detonation threshold

_field_real.name: heat loss per second#the amount of heat lost each second when the weapon is not being fired

_field_string_id.name: heat loss#function values sets the current heat loss per second
heat loss venting#function value sets the heat loss per second while weapon is being vented

_field_real_fraction.name: heat venting exit heat#heat at which to begin the venting exit animations so that the weapon is just about fully cooled when the exit animation completes.
heat illumination:[0,1]#the amount of illumination given off when the weapon is overheated
heat warning threshold#the amount of heat at which a warning will be displayed on the hud

_field_real.name: overheated heat loss per second#the amount of heat lost each second when the weapon is not being fired

_field_string_id.name: overheated heat loss#function values sets the heat loss per second when weapon is overheated

item.Name: sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base

_field_custom.name: overheated heat loss per second scale

_field_struct.name: overheated heat loss per second scale

item.Name: sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base
sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base

_field_block_64.name: melee damage parameters
_field_block_64._field_explanation: damage pyramid angles: defines the frustum from the camera that the melee-attack uses to find targets damage pyramid depth: how far the melee attack searches for a target

_field_real.name: damage pyramid depth:wu#0 defaults to k_default_player_melee_distance
maximum lunge range:wu#0 defaults to k_default_player_melee_lunge_distance
damage lunge explosive depth:wu#the distance out from the pyramid center to spawn explosive effects. This value will be clamped to the damage pyramid depth. 0 defaults to the damage pyramid depth

_field_tag_reference_64.name: lunge melee damage#this is only important for the energy sword
lunge melee response#this is only important for the energy sword
empty melee damage#this is only important for the energy sword
empty melee response#this is only important for the energy sword
clang melee damage#this is only important for the energy sword
clang melee response#this is only important for the energy sword
clang melee against melee weapon damage#e.g. used by AR to damage sword guy when clanging sword attack
clang melee against melee weapon damage response#e.g. used by AR to damage sword guy when clanging sword attack
clang effect#effect that is played in the air between two players that clang with this weapon

_field_short_integer.name: magnification levels#the number of magnification levels this weapon allows

_field_char_integer.name: zoom effect ticks#how often 'zoom effect' will be triggered (while zoomed)

_field_tag_reference_64.name: zoom effect#effect that is played while zoomed

_field_block_64.name: aim assist modes#First mode is normal, second mode is iron sights/scoped

item.Name: do not scale for magnification#Disables scaling distances by magnification and inverse scaling angles by magnification. Aim assist is normally scaled for magnification in order to have the same screen space result regardless of magnification.

_field_angle.name: autoaim angle:degrees#the maximum angle that autoaim works at full strength

_field_real.name: autoaim range:world units#autoaim only has an effect along this distance
autoaim falloff range:world units#at what point the autoaim starts falling off. Fully falls off at autoaim range.
autoaim near falloff range:world units#at what point the autoaim reaches full power

_field_angle.name: magnetism angle:degrees#the maximum angle that magnetism works at full strength

_field_real.name: magnetism range:world units#magnetism only has an effect along this distance
magnetism falloff range:world units#at what point magnetism starts falling off. Fully falls off at magnetism range.
magnetism near falloff range:world units#at what point magnetism reaches full power

_field_angle.name: deviation angle:degrees#the maximum angle that a projectile is allowed to deviate from the gun barrel due to autoaim OR network lead vector reconstruction

item.Name: do not scale for magnification#Disables scaling distances by magnification and inverse scaling angles by magnification. Aim assist is normally scaled for magnification in order to have the same screen space result regardless of magnification.

_field_custom.name: autoaim angle#the maximum angle that autoaim works at full strength

_field_struct.name: autoaim angle#the maximum angle that autoaim works at full strength

item.Name: sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base

_field_custom.name: prioritization angle#angle used to select model targets based on priority. 0 disables model target prioritization

_field_struct.name: prioritization angle#angle used to select model targets based on priority. 0 disables model target prioritization

addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base

_field_custom.name: deviation angle#the maximum angle that a projectile is allowed to deviate from the gun barrel due to autoaim OR network lead vector reconstruction

_field_struct.name: deviation angle#the maximum angle that a projectile is allowed to deviate from the gun barrel due to autoaim OR network lead vector reconstruction

item.Name: sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base
only enable when aimed down sight

_field_block_64.name: tracking types#specify the kinds of targets this tracking system can lock on

_field_real_bounds.name: ballistic arcing firing bounds:world units#At the min range (or closer), the minimum ballistic arcing is used, at the max (or farther away), the maximum arcing is used
ballistic arcing fraction bounds:[0-1]#Controls speed and degree of arc. 0 = low, fast, 1 = high, slow

_field_real_fraction.name: forward movement penalty#percent slowdown to forward movement for units carrying this weapon
sideways movement penalty#percent slowdown to sideways and backward movement for units carrying this weapon
gunner armor mod forward movement penalty#percent slowdown to forward movement for units carrying this weapon with the gunner armor mod active
gunner armor mod sideways movement penalty#percent slowdown to sideways and backward movement for units carrying this weapon with the gunner armor mod active

_field_real.name: Maximum pitch rate:degrees per second#This will cap the speed at which the player can aim when holding this weapon, probably want to set something sensible for turrets etc
Ammopack power capacity#Ammopack armormod - 0.2 would give 20% additional capacity to an energy weapon
age heat recovery penalty#how much the weapon's heat recovery is penalized as it ages
age rate of fire penalty#how much the weapon's rate of fire is penalized as it ages

_field_real_fraction.name: age misfire start:[0,1]#the age threshold when the weapon begins to misfire
age misfire chance:[0,1]#at age 1.0, the misfire chance per shot

_field_real.name: active camo ding#how much to decrease active camo when a round is fired

_field_string_id.name: handle node#the node that get's attached to the unit's hand

item.Name: ignores ammo swapper component#This item should not let the ammo swapper component display it
displays ammo as percentage of max#as opposed to individual bullet sprites
hide ammo#hides stored ammo and clip ammo displays

_field_real.name: first person fov scale#the multiplier by the standard first person FOV to use when this weapon is held
first person dof distance#the distance to apply depth of field to the weapon

_field_tag_reference_64.name: alternate hud screen reference#the parent of the weapon can indicate that this hud should be used instead of the default
ui hip fire reticle screen reference
ui sight front override screen reference
ui sight back override screen reference

_field_string_id.name: display name#friendly name for the item
help text#verbose usage info for use during gameplay
icon string id#legacy, from when we embedded the sprites into the font to get streaming behaviour

_field_long_integer.name: sprite index#frame inside the item's image strip which shows this item

_field_tag_reference_64.name: alt sprite#secondary bitmap file representing this item. for detail images, overlays etc.

item.Name: magazine cannot change state while firing#will prevent reload until fire is complete (sticky det)

_field_short_integer.name: Ammopack rounds total initial#AmmoPack armormod - alternate total_initial value due to AmmoPack
Ammopack rounds total maximum#AmmoPack armormod - alternate total_maximum value due to armor mod AmmoPack

_field_real.name: reload dialogue time:seconds#the length of time we wait before saying the reload dialogue
chamber time:seconds - NOT USED!#the length of time it takes to chamber the next round

item.Name: spew#fires its primary action barrel whenever the trigger is down
latch#fires its primary action barrel when the trigger is down and then latches
latch-autofire#fires its primary action barrel once if pulsed quickly or if not depressed all the way, otherwise does secondary behavior
latch-tether#tethers projectiles if latched long enough, on release the tethered projectile detonates
latch-zoom#latched; fires its primary action barrel when unzoomed, secondary when zoomed
double-latch-tether#projectile is tethered by 1st latch, 2nd releases and detonates it
charge-with-magazine#like charge, but pays attention to any magazine and will not charge unless magazine is idle and barrel is actually able to fire

_field_real.name: charging time:seconds#the amount of time it takes for this trigger to become fully charged
charged time:seconds#the amount of time this trigger can be charged before becoming overcharged

item.Name: can fire spew fraction from partial charge{can fire from partial charge}#discharging a partially charged weapon will spew for the charged fraction of the spew time set below
limit to current rounds loaded#if magazine present, do not fire more than current rounds loaded (mantis rocket launcher)
Wont charge unless tracked target is valid#spew-charge triggers only

_field_short_integer.name: cancelled trigger throw#96 was the constant in code for the pp

_field_real.name: charged illumination:[0,1]#the amount of illumination given off when the weapon is fully charged

_field_tag_reference_64.name: charging effect#the charging effect is created once when the trigger begins to charge
charging damage effect#the charging effect is created once when the trigger begins to charge
charging continuous damage response#plays every tick you're charging or charged, scaled to charging fraction

_field_real.name: charged drain rate#how much battery to drain per second when charged

_field_tag_reference_64.name: discharge effect#the discharging effect is created once when the trigger releases its charge
discharge damage effect#the discharging effect is created once when the trigger releases its charge

_field_real_fraction.name: charge fraction^:[0.1]#charging fraction at which the weapon should additionally fire a shot.

_field_tag_reference_64.name: double latch projectile releasable effect#created once player is able to release the tethered projectile
double latch projectile released effect#created when player releases the tethered projectile

_field_block_64.name: barrels

item.Name: random firing effects#rather than being chosen sequentially, firing effects are picked randomly
can fire with partial ammo#allows a weapon to be fired as long as there is a non-zero amount of ammunition loaded
projectiles use weapon origin#instead of coming out of the magic first person camera origin, the projectiles for this weapon actually come out of the gun
ejects during chamber#this trigger's ejection port is started during the key frame of its chamber animation
projectile vector cannot be adjusted#projectiles fired by this weapon cannot have their direction adjusted by the AI to hit the target
projectiles fire parallel#If there are multiple guns for this trigger, the projectiles emerge in parallel beams (rather than independant aiming)
don't clear fire bit after recovering
prevent marker deviation#the barrel will not fire if all markers are pointed further away from the desired aiming vector than the aim assist deviation angle
error ignores zoom#disables of the barrel error inversely with the zoom magnification
projectile fires in marker direction#projectiles shoot out the marker direction instead of the player's aim vector
skip test for object being outside BSP#Prevents projectile origin from changing when object is outside of BSP; Useful for units that can be placed inside physics.
only reload if all barrels idle
only switch weapons if barrel idle#the weapon's owner cannot switch weapons unless this barrel is in the idle state

_field_real_bounds.name: rounds per second#the number of firing effects created per second. 0 defaults to 60

_field_string_id.name: rate of fire acceleration#function value sets the current rate of fire when the barrel is firing

_field_real.name: acceleration time:seconds#the continuous firing time it takes for the weapon to achieve its final rounds per second

_field_string_id.name: rate of fire deceleration#function value sets the current rate of fire when the barrel is not firing

_field_real.name: deceleration time:seconds#the continuous idle time it takes for the weapon to return from its final rounds per second to its initial
barrel spin scale#scale the barrel spin speed by this amount

_field_real_fraction.name: blurred rate of fire#a percentage between 0 and 1 which controls how soon in its firing animation the weapon blurs

_field_short_integer_bounds.name: shots per fire#allows designer caps to the shots you can fire from one firing action

_field_real.name: fire recovery time:seconds#how long after a set of shots it takes before the barrel can fire again

_field_real_fraction.name: soft recovery fraction#how much of the recovery allows shots to be queued

_field_real.name: melee fire recovery time:seconds#how long after a set of shots it takes before the weapon can melee

_field_real_fraction.name: melee soft recovery fraction#how much of the melee recovery allows melee to be queued

_field_real.name: runtime rate of fire acceleration rate!
runtime rate of fire deceleration rate!

_field_short_block_index.name: magazine#the magazine from which this trigger draws its ammunition

_field_short_integer.name: rounds per shot#the number of rounds expended to create a single firing effect
minimum rounds loaded#the minimum number of rounds necessary to fire the weapon
rounds per burst#if > 0 this will be the ammo consumed at the start of a new burst. Automatic reloads will wait for burst to finish
rounds between tracers#the number of non-tracer rounds fired between tracers

_field_short_enum.name: ai noise#how loud this weapon appears to the AI when firing

item.Name: silent#ai will not respond to this sound
loud#ai can hear this sound at any range

_field_short_enum.name: motion tracker noise#how far the weapon can be heard on the motion tracker when firing

_field_block_64._field_explanation: what the behavior of this barrel is in a predicted network game

_field_real.name: event_synchronized_projectiles_per_second#Valid only for barrels set to prediction type "continuous". Controls how many projectiles per second can be individually synchronized (use debug_projectiles to diagnose).

maximum_barrel_error_for_event_synchronization#Valid only for barrels set to prediction type "continuous". If the barrel's current error level is over this value (zero to one scale), we will not consider synchronizing projectiles with individual events (use debug_projectiles to diagnose).

_field_block_64._field_explanation: full error look pitch rate controlls how fast you can turn with full error, yaw is implied from pitch. 0==130. for reference, profile sensitivities are set to: 1: 40 3: 60 9: 130

_field_angle.name: min error look pitch rate#yaw rate is doubled
full error look pitch rate#yaw rate is doubled

_field_real.name: look pitch error power#use to soften or sharpen the rate ding

_field_block_64.name: direction offset#Custom vectors must be set in distribution function above
position offsets#Custom vectors must be set in distribution function above

_field_real_point_2d.name: Point offset^:[-1.1]#x-y offset - +x is right, +y is up

_field_real.name: distribution angle:degrees#used by distribution function 'horizontal fan' above
deceleration time:seconds#the continuous idle time it would take for a barrel_error of 1.0 to return to its minimum value.

_field_angle.name: minimum error:degrees#projectile direction is randomly selected between this and max_error_angle below

_field_angle_bounds.name: error angle:degrees (max_error_angle)#current barrel_error is linearly interpolated between these to generate max_error_angle

_field_real_bounds.name: damage error#the range of angles (in degrees) that a damaged weapon will skew fire

_field_real.name: reload penalty#percentage accuracy lost when reloading
switch penalty#percentage accuracy lost when switching weapons
zoom penalty#percentage accuracy lost when zooming in/out
jump penalty#percentage accuracy lost when jumping

_field_block_64._field_explanation: barrel_error = barrel_error + penaltyfunction(barrel_error) Where input value 'X' produces output value 'Y'

_field_block_64.name: firing penalty function#percentage accuracy lost when the barrel has fired
firing crouched penalty function#percentage accuracy lost when the barrel has fired from a crouched position
moving penalty function#percentage accuracy lost when moving
turning penalty function#percentage accuracy lost when turning the camera

_field_real.name: error angle max rotation#angle which represents the maximum input to the turning penalty function.

_field_block_64.name: firing penalty function#percentage accuracy lost when the barrel has fired
firing crouched penalty function#percentage accuracy lost when the barrel has fired from a crouched position
moving penalty function#percentage accuracy lost when moving
turning penalty function#percentage accuracy lost when turning the camera

_field_real.name: error angle max rotation#angle which represents the maximum input to the turning penalty function.

_field_real_point_3d.name: first person offset:world units#+x is forward, +z is up, +y is left

_field_real.name: ejection port recovery time#the amount of time (in seconds) it takes for the ejection port to transition from 1.0 (open) to 0.0 (closed) after a shot has been fired
illumination recovery time#the amount of time (in seconds) it takes the illumination function to transition from 1.0 (bright) to 0.0 (dark) after a shot has been fired

_field_real_fraction.name: heat generated per round:[0,1]#the amount of heat generated each time the barrel fires. Unlike the name suggests, this amount of heat is NOT applied per projectile created.

_field_string_id.name: heat generated per round function&heat generated per round#function value sets the amount of heat to add to the weapon each tick the barrel is firing

_field_real_fraction.name: deprecated age generated per round{age generated per round}*!:[0,1]#the amount the weapon ages each time the trigger is fired
deprecated CAMPAIGN age generated per round{CAMPAIGN age generated per round}*!:[0,1]#the amount the weapon ages each time the trigger is fired
age generated per round:[0,1]#the amount the weapon ages each time the trigger is fired
CAMPAIGN age generated per round:[0,1]#the amount the weapon ages each time the trigger is fired

_field_real.name: overload time:seconds#the next trigger fires this often while holding down this trigger

_field_block_64.name: firing effects#firing effects determine what happens when this trigger is fired

_field_short_integer.name: shot count lower bound#the minimum number of times this firing effect will be used, once it has been chosen
shot count upper bound#the maximum number of times this firing effect will be used, once it has been chosen

_field_tag_reference_64.name: firing effect^#this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and fired normally
critical effect^#this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and will do critical damage
misfire effect#this effect is used when the weapon is loaded but fired while overheated
empty effect#this effect is used when the weapon is not loaded
optional secondary firing effect#this effect is for later shots of a burst if set
firing damage#this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and fired normally
critical damage^#this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and will do critical damage
misfire damage#this effect is used when the weapon is loaded but fired while overheated
empty damage#this effect is used when the weapon is not loaded
optional secondary firing damage#this effect is for later shots of a burst if set
firing rider damage#this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and fired normally
critical rider damage^#this effect is used when the weapon is loaded and will do critical damage
misfire rider damage#this effect is used when the weapon is loaded but fired while overheated
empty rider damage#this effect is used when the weapon is not loaded
optional secondary firing rider damage#this effect is for later shots of a burst if set

_field_block_64._field_explanation:
If you don't specifiy hip settings, these settings will be used for both hip and precision aim. Yaw: +right Pitch: +up
Min magnitude: Min magnitude is only applied when the randomness can be in a positive or negative direction. It guarantees a random number generated will be at least this magnitude. Randomness is redistributed in the range of the min magnitude to the largest random bound in that direction The end result is clamped to the random bounds.

_field_real.name: recoil impulse scale ground throttle#0 defaults to 1. Stick value magnitude when on ground. Interpolates from 1 to this based off of throttle magnitude.
recoil impulse scale crouched#0 defaults to 1. Interpolates from 1 to this based off of crouch.
recoil impulse scale airborne#0 defaults to 1. Only uses this scale when airborne, but not stabilized
recoil impulse scale stabilized#0 defaults to 1. Only uses this scale when stabilized
recoil impulse scale ground throttle#0 defaults to 1. Stick value magnitude when on ground. Interpolates from 1 to this based off of throttle magnitude.
recoil impulse scale crouched#0 defaults to 1. Interpolates from 1 to this based off of crouch.
recoil impulse scale airborne#0 defaults to 1. Only uses this scale when airborne, but not stabilized
recoil impulse scale stabilized#0 defaults to 1. Only uses this scale when stabilized

_field_block_64._field_explanation: Min magnitude: Min magnitude is only applied when the randomness can be in a positive or negative direction. It guarantees a random number generated will be at least this magnitude. Randomness is redistributed in the range of the min magnitude to the largest random bound in that direction The end result is clamped to the random bounds.

_field_real.name: recoil impulse scale ground throttle#0 defaults to 1. Stick value magnitude when on ground. Interpolates from 1 to this based off of throttle magnitude.
recoil impulse scale crouched#0 defaults to 1. Interpolates from 1 to this based off of crouch.
recoil impulse scale airborne#0 defaults to 1. Only uses this scale when airborne, but not stabilized
recoil impulse scale stabilized#0 defaults to 1. Only uses this scale when stabilized
recoil impulse scale ground throttle#0 defaults to 1. Stick value magnitude when on ground. Interpolates from 1 to this based off of throttle magnitude.
recoil impulse scale crouched#0 defaults to 1. Interpolates from 1 to this based off of crouch.
recoil impulse scale airborne#0 defaults to 1. Only uses this scale when airborne, but not stabilized
recoil impulse scale stabilized#0 defaults to 1. Only uses this scale when stabilized

plugin._field_explanation: Gunkick rotates the first person weapon around the camera to offset the gun on screen. When aimed down sight, this will modify your weapon's firing direction. Uses a spring damper system to pull the gun back to the center left = +yaw up = +pitch

_field_real.name: gunkick spring constant#scales the return acceleration based on distance.applied per axis
gunkick damping ratio#0 would be no damping, 1 is critical damping. Is used to automatically calculate the damping coefficient
gunkick spring constant#scales the return acceleration based on distance.applied per axis
gunkick damping ratio#0 would be no damping, 1 is critical damping. Is used to automatically calculate the damping coefficient

_field_angle_bounds.name: gunkick yaw bounds:degrees#0 defaults to -10,10. Max bounds -10,10
gunkick pitch bounds:degrees#0 defaults to -10,10. Max bounds -10,10

item.Name: sequential#applies the percentages one after another on the base
total percentage#adds up all of the percentages and applies them to the base
addition#adds on all of the modifiers to the base
product#multiplies the values one after another on to the base

_field_real.name: procedural animation fp fire spring constant#scales the center spring acceleration based on distance
procedural animation fp fire damping ratio#0 would be no damping, 1 is critical damping. Is used to automatically calculate the damping coefficient

_field_block_64.name: procedural animation fp fire spring hip#add a block to override fire spring in hip

_field_real.name: procedural animation fp fire spring constant#scales the center spring acceleration based on distance
procedural animation fp fire damping ratio#0 would be no damping, 1 is critical damping. Is used to automatically calculate the damping coefficient

pickup weapon unit attachment point#Which marker on the unit model to attach the pickup weapon to.
